papers.title: Review of Accelerator-based Boron Neutron Capture Therapy Machines
authors: Boron Neutron Capture Therapy (BNCT) is a promising method for cancer therapy. A few accelerator-based BNCT projects are in progress in Japan
and plans for such systems are discussed in Europe
Taiwan and Korea. To obtain sufficient epi-thermal neutron flux

30-50 kW of proton beam power is required. This talk reviews the present situation of the BNCT projects in the world. Key issues for the stable production of epi-thermal neutrons for medical applications are discussed. This includes the type of accelerator (linac or cyclotron)
the selection of proton energy (3 MeV
the coice of target (Li or Be) and moderator.
